title: 'Stfu' and 'wtf' are instant triggers for chat restrions, but 'kkk' and 'kys' aren't.
body: Nice one Riot. This system has me laughing since it was released. Easy entertainment.

replies.body:
They actually aren't. Alone, simply cursing isn't a problem at all and won't result in a restriction. If you are constantly harassing people *while* cursing, you can be punished and it'll have nothing to do with saying "fuck".

As for "kys", it's definitely a bannable offense. I frequently see chat logs where a player is escalated past chat restrictions to a ban for that.
^^^ What you (OP) say is an oversimplification and also just not true. The system may use keywords to identify behaviour patterns, but it does not use keywords alone as triggers for punishments.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=N2L1Uy2o,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-04-08T08:18:14.879+0000)
>
> ^^^ What you (OP) say is an oversimplification and also just not true. The system may use keywords to identify behaviour patterns, but it does not use keywords alone as triggers for punishments.

In my last game I said wtf and stfu once each. I, and only I, was punished whereas the guy calling me a %%%got, %%%%%%, jew, and a 'slanty-eyed %%%%%' was not punished.

Firs of all, you seem like the kinda guy who has a looooooong history of negativity from your interactions here on boards, so you'd be on thin ice as far as the system was concerned. That said, just because you only said "wtf" and "stfu" once, doesn't mean you wren't saying things like "holy hell you're so bad" and "you are a trash tier [role]". Ofc, these are only examples, the point being it's not keywords that get you banned, it's context. If you really want to know what specifically would have gotten you punished then post your logs.

As for the other guy, how do you know he wasn't punished? The notification is notoriously rare, and there are loads of circumstances that mean it won't show up at all. Just because you didn't get one doesn't mean he wasn't punished.

He was in my next three games and mouthing off in /all

Did anyone actually report him? Or did everyone just leave the post game. If noone reports then the behaviour isn't flagged. Ultimately players decide what is not ok.

Assuming you did, the instant feedback system usually punished in about 10 minutes (though not always) but it's possible the behaviour was escalated for a manual review. Admittedly I'm not 100% sure what the process there is since we only get told so much.

Mate you can get banned from general friendly banter. I'm happy to post up one of my chat logs to show you that even having a giggle with someone can get you chat restricted or used as a strike against you. And I'm not talking about abusing someone in a joking matter or anything alike. I'm talking about banter between yourself and an enemy team player who's been harassing you all game long who in return reports you because you pointed out you outplayed them. No one called anyone bad, etc or said anything derogatory etc, it was just friendly banter between both players but because he got salty he lost himself and his duo reported me.

In fact, you can call an enemy player trash etc in TEAM chat and still be banned for it. Because the automated system is pathetic.
kkk is an organisation. it shouldnt be bannable to say kkk.
